cab.content:
This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.
SECRET.
G.T.6029
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 18th OCTOBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
On the Fourth Army battle front the line runs :- east of WASSIGNY, east of MAZINGHIEN, west of BAZUEL thence to north of LE CA?AU.
North of the SENSEE the line runs :- MARQUETTE, MONCHECOURT, MONTIGNY, LALLAING, FAUMONT, FRETIN, SAINGHIN, ASCQ, ROUBAIX (unofficial), west of MOUSCRON (all inclusive).
There is nothing to report from the Belgian front.
French Front.
There is nothing to report.
2. ITALIAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
3. BALKAN FRONT.
In ALBANIA the Italians have occupied the heights north of DURAZZO and their cavalry have reached BAZAR SYAK. They are also advancing on VORRA through TIRANA.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.I.
18th October, 1918.
Issued at 7 p.m.
